Miti in resnica o holesterolu
Holesterol je v našem telesu nekaj običajnega in nepogrešljivega, saj je sestavni del celičnih membran, ima vlogo pri nastajanju nekaterih hormonov in vitamina D. Ker je lahko v nekaterih primerih tudi nevaren za naše zdravje, nosi vzdevek tihi ubijalec.
07 Nov 2019, 07:16 by P. I.



Povišana vsebnost slabega holesterola je lahko tudi usodna. FOTO: Getty Images/istockphoto



FOTO: Sanofarm



Biostatine MED FOTO: Sanofarm


Poznamo t. i. dobri in slabi holesterol – ker je zadnji gostejši, začne mašiti stene žil in ovirati pretok krvi. Ko ga je preveč, lahko povzroči srčno-žilne bolezni oz. stanja (arteroskleroza, angina pektoris, srčni infarkt, možganska kap, gangrena) in celo smrt. To lahko prizadene predvsem osebe, ki se nezdravo prehranjujejo; zaužijejo veliko nasičenih maščob, alkohola; kadilce, diabetike s sladkorno boleznijo tipa 2 in tiste, ki imajo hiperholesterolemijo v družini ali že trpijo za srčno-žilno boleznijo.Obljubite si, da bodo vrednosti holesterola na naslednjem pregledu nižje! S kombinacijo naravnih učinkovin k temu učinkovito pripomore Biostatine MED, ki obenem odpravlja motnje v presnovi maščob.
To pa je le ena plat zgodbe. O holesterolu kroži veliko dejstev pa tudi mitov, ki ne držijo. Naj jih nekaj pojasnimo.
1.    Povišano raven holesterola v krvi imajo samo starejši od 50 let.Žal ima povišan holesterol vse več mlajših oseb, tudi otroci. Je pa res, da se posledice pogosteje začnejo kazati po 50. letu pri moških, pri ženskah pa po 60. Zato vsekakor niso odveč redni pregledi že po 35. letu pri moških in po 45. letu pri ženskah. 2.    Suhi ljudje nimajo težav s holesterolom.Povišano raven holesterola v krvi imajo lahko vsi tipi ljudi, zato si njegove vrednosti v krvi redno merite.3.    Če holesterol ne presega 5, ni panike. Stopnja holesterola, ki presega mejo 5 milimolov na liter krvi, je že rizična in pomeni močno povečano tveganje za srčno-žilne bolezni. Za povišano raven se šteje že, če je skupni holesterol nad 4, slab oziroma LDL-holesterol pa nad 1,8 milimola na liter krvi.4.    Uporaba margarine namesto masla bo znižala holesterol. Margarina vsebuje transmaščobe, ki povzročajo povišano vrednost slabega holesterola.5.    Za previsoko raven holesterola v krvi je kriv sodoben način življenja. Sodoben način življenja nam prinaša pozitivne stvari in tudi marsikatero skušnjavo. Vsak posameznik je sam odgovoren za svoj življenjski slog. Poznamo veliko oblik rekreacije, ki niso nujno povezane z visokimi stroški; neomejena količina znanja in informacij o zdravem načinu življenja nam je dostopna kar na internetu; še vedno se večinoma sami odločamo, kako se bomo prehranjevali. Čim bolj se izogibajmo nezdravi prehrani in škodljivim razvadam, kot so cigarete in alkohol.

Cholesterol myths and truth
Cholesterol is something common and indispensable in our body because it is an integral part of cell membranes, it plays a role in the production of certain hormones and vitamin D. Because in some cases it can be dangerous for our health, it is nicknamed the silent killer.
07 Nov 2019, 07:16 by P.I.



Increased levels of bad cholesterol can also be fatal. PHOTO: Getty Images / istockphoto



PHOTO: Sanofarm



Biostats MED PHOTO: Sanofarm


We know t. i. good and bad cholesterol - because the latter is denser, it begins to clog the walls of the veins and impede blood flow. When it is too much, it can cause cardiovascular disease. conditions (arteriosclerosis, angina, heart attack, stroke, gangrene) and even death. This can mainly affect people who eat unhealthily; consume a lot of saturated fat, alcohol; smokers, diabetics with type 2 diabetes, and those with hypercholesterolemia in the family or already suffering from cardiovascular disease. Promise that your cholesterol levels will be lower at the next examination! By combining natural ingredients, Biostatine MED effectively contributes to the elimination of fat metabolism disorders.
This, however, is only one side of the story. There are many facts about cholesterol, as well as myths that do not hold true. Let's explain some of them.
1. Elevated blood cholesterol levels are only older than 50. Unfortunately, cholesterol is on the rise in younger people, including children. However, it is true that the consequences start to show more often after the age of 50 in men and in women after 60. Therefore, regular check-ups after 35 years in men and after 45 years in women are definitely not superfluous. 2. Dry people have no problem with cholesterol. All types of people can have elevated blood cholesterol levels, so you should regularly measure their blood levels. 3. If cholesterol does not exceed 5, there is no panic. A cholesterol level exceeding the limit of 5 millimoles per liter of blood is already at risk and poses a significant increased risk of cardiovascular disease. An elevated level is considered to be considered if the total cholesterol is above 4 and the low or LDL cholesterol is above 1.8 millimoles per liter of blood.4. Using margarine instead of butter will lower your cholesterol. Margarine contains trans fats that cause elevated levels of bad cholesterol.5. The modern way of life is to blame for high blood cholesterol levels. Modern lifestyles bring us positive things and many temptations. Each individual is responsible for their own lifestyle. There are many forms of recreation that are not necessarily associated with high costs; an unlimited amount of knowledge and information about healthy lifestyles is available on the Internet; most of the time we still decide how we eat. Avoid unhealthy diets and harmful habits such as cigarettes and alcohol as much as possible.

Doctors like to prescribe chemical statins, which have many bad side effects. Therefore, it is a good idea to have natural help that effectively lowers cholesterol.
